intro: Lamprodithyros, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Lamprodithyros is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
